chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant James D Tessmer Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Obtain high school diploma or equivalent. Maintain FTE/FT school or a combination.

Assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate.
Letter of apology to J.P., K.L., & K.C.
Continue counseling w/ Dr. C

Defendant is eligible for expungement if successfully completes all probation requirements and has no new charges.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Case Called: 4:10 pm
Includes 14CF932 and 14CF933.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer. Defendant appears in person and with Atty Andrew Morgan.
Date and time set for Motion to Revoked the Deferred Entry of Judgment.
COURT Enters Judgment on Ct. 1 in 14CF932 and finds Defendant Guilty. VRCW. 
Parties argue expungment eligibility.

COURT ORDERS: 2 Years Probation. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate, Letter of apology to J.P., K.L., K.C., pay restitution in the amount of $100 to J.P., Successfully complete 20 hours Community Service, Obtain High School Diploma or an equivalent, Counseling as recommended by agent and continue counseling with Dr. Cameron, Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination, Court Costs. Defendant is eligible for expungment if successfully completes all probation requirements and no new charges.

Adj: 4:19 pm

BOTR: 4:21 pm

Defendant is eligible for expungment if successfully completes all probation requirements and no new charges.

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 8:27 a.m. 
**Includes 14CF932, 14CF933, 14CF998 & 14CM1961**
State appears by ADA Elisabeth Gramer. Defendant appears with Attorney Andrew Morgan. 
State notes date & time set for preliminary hearing on 14CF932, 14CF933 & 14CM998 and parties have reached a plea agreement on all files. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed.  
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  Reading Waived.
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief  filed.  VRCW.
State moves to:  14CF932- DRI Ct. 2 Theft- Movable Property
                            14CF998- DRI Cts.1-5 Bail Jumping (Misd) & DRI Cts. 6-10 Bail Jumping (Felony) 
                            14CM1961- DRI Ct.1 Criminal Damage to Property & DRI Ct.2 Disorderly Conduct
COURT GRANTS. 
PLEA: 14CF932- Ct.1 Take and Drive Vehicle without Consent>>NO CONTEST
           14CF933- Ct.1 Take and Drive Vehicle without Consent>>NO CONTEST
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: DEOJ for 18 months. Defendant to comply with conditions as stated in the agreement adopted by the court. If defendant successfully completes conditions of DEOJ, charges will be amended to 2 counts Disorderly Conduct- 947.01(1) with CC on each count. Once defendant reaches age 21 and does not have any new charges, defendant will be eligible for expungement.
COURT signs DEOJ agreement. 
Bond to continue.

records.addlTxt: INCLUDES 14CM1961, 14CF932, 14CF933.  Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.  No contact with victim(s): K.L.; J.P.; K.C.; nor co-defendant M.S.   Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Curfew 8:00 p.m. to 7:00 a.m.  No missed school.
